channel.description: This podcast is a showcase of World, African, Reggae, Rock, Jam, Blues, Latin, Dub, conscious, UK, US, music. I hope you like the mix

item.title: Podcast 41 - Inventions from the Extrapolating Tie-Dyed Rabbit Hole
item.description: Podcast 41 - Inventions from the Extrapolating Tie-Dyed Rabbit Hole This podcast contains: Artist; Song; Album 1. Baby Grandmothers; Somebody Keeps Calling My Name; Baby Grandmothers 2. McFadden's Parachute; Crashing Into Amethyst; Black Fuzz 3. Wooden Shjips; Lucy's Ride; Wooden Shjips 4. The Freak Scene; Rose of Smiling Faces; Psychedelic Psoul 5. Saint Steven; Gladacodova; Over The Hills/The Bastich 6. Gilberto Gil; A Voz Do Vivo; Gilberto Gil 7. Magic Mixture; Living On a Hill; This Is the Magic Mixture 8. Black Moth Super Rainbow; Rollerdisco; Dandelion Gum 9. Neighb'rhood Children; Patterns; Long Years In Space 10. Jimi Hendrix; Machine Gun; 2 Nights at the Fillmore 11. Alrune Rod; Flyv Fugl Fisk; Ragnarock 12. Karma; Transe Uma; Karma 13. Woorden; Woorden(Excerpt); Waterpipes and Dykes 14. The Majority; Time Machine Man; Psychedelic Jumble Volume One 15. Usha Khanna; Hotel Incidental Music; Psych Funk Sa-Re-Ga 16. Family; Voyage; Music In a Doll's House 17. Family; The Breeze; Music In a Doll's House 18. The Flow; Baghdad Express; The Flow's Greatest Hits 19. Beachwood Sparks; Once We Were Trees; Once We Were Trees 20. Koes Bersaudara; Djadikan Aku Domba Mu ( Meke Me Your Sheep); 1967 21. Misty Wizards; It's Love; Electric Psychedelic Sitar Headswirlers Volume One 22. Os Steamers; Seraj Assim ata Morrer; Various Artists Portugese Nuggets 23. Os Mutantes; Gloria Ao Rei nos Confins Do Alem; Brazilian 60's Nuggets 24. Acid Mothers Gong; Supercotton 2; Acid Motherhood 25. Causa Sui; El Paraiso; Causa Sui 26. Dashiell Hedayat; Fille De L'Ombre; Obsolete 27. The Head Shop; Heaven Here We Come; The Head Shop 28. Shun Jung Hyun & Men; Woman In the Mist; It's A Lie 29. Grateful Dead; Dark Star; Glastonbury Fayre Well folks this podcast is a Mega Mix of Psychedelic sounds from around the globe, featuring songs/tunes/music from the sixties to the present. A number of tracks feature extended workouts, and the air is heady with patchouli, and sandalwood, the tie dyed cushions/curtains/clothes are scattered about, and the revolutions are all happening with sound/action/police brutality/and thoughts of world peace/love and sharing. On a more sombre note who would have thought so many would be imprisoned around the globe for marijuana usage, when most, if not all current political leaders have admitted to partaking of this"illegal" substance, sometimes hypocrisy has no bounds. Hope you like the mix............. Notes: 2. http://www.myspace.com/mcfadden39sparachute 3. http://www.woodenshjips.com/ 4. http://www.allmusic.com/artist/the-freak-scene-p17687/biography 6. http://www.gilbertogil.com.br/ 8. http://www.blackmothsuperrainbow.com/ 9. http://www.badbrains.com/ 10. http://www.jimihendrix.com/us/home 11. http://www.myspace.com/AlruneRod 15. http://www.mohdrafi.com/meri-awaaz-suno/mohammed-rafis-association-with-composer-usha-khanna.html 16. http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Family_%28band%29 17. http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Family_%28band%29 19. http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Beachwood_Sparks 20. http://www.garagehangover.com/?q=koesbersaudara 23. http://www.myspace.com/osmutantes 24. http://www.acidmothers.com/ 25. http://www.causasui.com/ 27. http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Head_Shop 29. http://www.dead.net/

Podcast 41 - Inventions from the Extrapolating Tie-Dyed Rabbit Hole This podcast contains: Artist; Song; Album
1. Baby Grandmothers; Somebody Keeps Calling My Name; Baby Grandmothers 2. McFadden's Parachute; Crashing Into Amethyst; Black Fuzz 3. Wooden Shjips; Lucy's Ride; Wooden Shjips 4. Shun Jung Hyun & Men; Woman In the Mist; It's A Lie 29. Grateful Dead; Dark Star; Glastonbury Fayre
Well folks this podcast is a Mega Mix of Psychedelic sounds from around the globe, featuring songs/tunes/music from the sixties to the present. A number of tracks feature extended workouts, and the air is heady with patchouli, and sandalwood, the tie dyed cushions/curtains/clothes are scattered about, and the revolutions are all happening with sound/action/police brutality/and thoughts of world peace/love and sharing. On a more sombre note who would have thought so many would be imprisoned around the globe for marijuana usage, when most, if not all current political leaders have admitted to partaking of this"illegal" substance, sometimes hypocrisy has no bounds. Hope you like the mix.............

item.title: Podcast 40 - Big Happies Lyricalirrilly
item.description: This podcast contains: Artist; Song; Album 1. Los Fabulocos; If You Know; Los Fabulocos 2. Charlie Hunter, Chinna Smith, Ernest Ranglin; What I Am; Earth Tones(Bread Fruit) 3. Amnesty; Mr. President; Free Your Mind 4. Miles Davis; Recollections; Big Fun 5. Luis Vecchio; Chabati; Afro-Rock 6. Laba Sosseh; Sayni Kay Fonema; el Sonero De Africa Vol 1 7. Lou Bond; Come On Snob; Lou Bond 8. Kurt Elling; Endless; The Message 9. Bad Brains; Ghetto; I and I Survived 10. Kurt Elling; It's Just A Thing; The Messenger 11. Le Grand Kalle,Don Gonzalo & Manu Dibango; Disiplini na K.D.L.; L'African Team 12. The Mar-Keys; Grab This Thing (Part 2); Funk Soul Brother Series Vol 3 13. Baay Sooly, Carlou D., Country Man; Wouty Zion; African Rebel Music 14. Chairmen of The Board; Skin I'm In; Skin I'm In 15. Pablove Black & Sound Dimension; Consumer (Version); Coxsone 7" 16. Max Tannone; Ms. Vampire Booty; Mos Dub Usual Mixed bag here, shifting and shaping the sounds, starts pretty mellow but picks up along the way, WARNING 17 minute Miles track with John MacLaughlin on guitar, and a special shoutout to Kurt S. for introducing me to the choons of Kurt Elling. Hope you like the mix.......... Notes: 1. http://www.deltagrooveproductions.com/music/artists/losfabulocos/main.html 3. http://amnestytheband.com/review_20070213_stopsmilingonline.html 4. http://www.milesdavis.com/au/home 6. http://www.descarga.com/cgi-bin/db/archives/Profile88 7. http://staxrecords.free.fr/lbond.htm 8. http://kurtelling.com/index.php 9. http://www.badbrains.com/ 10. http://kurtelling.com/index.php 12. http://www.history-of-rock.com/markeys.htm 13. http://www.thisisafrica.me/artists/detail/463/Baay-Sooley 14. http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chairmen_of_the_Board_%28band%29 16. http://www.maxtannone.com/

item.title: Podcast 39- Hello Your Quietness Sound Systema
item.description: Podcast 39- Hello Your Quietness Sound Systema This podcast contains: Artist; Song; Album 1. Liquid Stranger; Rough Road; The Intergalactic Slapstick 2. Sister Olidia;Sodom Dub; Sodom and Gomorrah EP 3. Choc Quib Town; Pescao Envenenao; Somos Pacifico 4. Carlinhos Brown; Crendice; Bahia Do Mundo 5. D-Roy Band; Ben Dub; Orthodox Dub 6. Nit Grit; Babylon featuring Relic n Caballo; Sonidero Revolucionera 7. Os Mutantes; El Justiciero; Jardim Eletrico 8. Million Stylez and Joey Fever; Young Guns; Come Down Riddim 9. Jackie and Soul Vendors; Grooving Steady; Musical Fever 1967-1968 10. DJ Dolores; Wakaru; 1 Real 11. Larry Young; Hello Your Quietness; Lawrence of Newark 12. Fermin Muguruza; Loturak; Ashmatic Lion Sound Systema 13. Vitrola Adubada; Satisfacao; Buguinha Dub 14. Blue Stingrays; Surfer's Life; Surf-N-Burn 15. Aztlan Underground; Nahui Ollin; Sub-Verses 16. Caballo and the Mothafu Kings; Follow Your Heart; Global Propaganda 17. Ed Nangle; Good Girl; Musical Fever 1967-1968 18. James Brown; Cold Sweat; James Brown and the Famous Flames 1967-11-25 L'Olympia,Paris Been a while, life gets in the way, hope this set of tracks will bring some Festive Season cheer to all and sundry. The usual, the unusual, the downright deadly and the truly smoking, globally extending the parameters of sound and dynamics. What a blurb!? Hope you like the mix......... Notes: 1. http://www.myspace.com/liquidstranger 3. http://chocquibtown.com/ 4. http://www.carlinhosbrown.com.br/en/mosaic/community-work/pracatum-music-school/ 7. http://www.osmutantes.com/ 9. http://www.soulvendors.com/jackiemittoo.html 10. http://www.myspace.com/dj.dolores 11. http://www.larryyoungmusic.com/ 12. http://www.muguruzafm.com/ 14. http://www.wildbluegator.com/mike/bluefish.htm 15. http://aztlanunderground.net/blog/ 16. http://www.myspace.com/caballorebel 18. http://www.artistdirect.com/artist/bio/james-brown/408807

item.title: Episode 38: SoundSkull - Tricksteps
item.description: Welcome to the Quiz, put this set of tracks together some time ago, and was going to add some different tracks, took some out of the file and added others. Then forgot what I'd removed, hence the quiz. Can you name the tracks? I seem to have plenty of friends on this site and hopefully a few listeners, so let's see if you can work out the track listing. Hope you like the mix.......
item.dc:creator: Dread_Lightning_Kelly
item.itunes:summary: Welcome to the Quiz, put this set of tracks together some time ago, and was going to add some different tracks, took some out of the file and added others. Then forgot what I'd removed, hence the quiz. Can you name the tracks? I seem to have plenty of friends on this site and hopefully a few listeners, so let's see if you can work out the track listing. Hope you like the mix.......

item.title: Podcast 37 - Raining Sunshine
item.description: Podcast 37 - Raining Sunshine This podcast contains: Artist; Song; Album 1. Renee Geyer; It's A Man's Man's World; It's A Man's Man's World 2. Turner Brothers; Running In the Rain; Act 1 3. Weldon Irvine; Sinbad; Sinbad 4. Willie Bobo and the Bo-Gents; Shut Up and Pay Attention; Do What You Want to Do 5. James Brown; Trying To Get Over; Slaughter's Big Rip-Off 6. Bama the Village Poet; Welfare Slave; Ghettoes of the Mind 7. Manu Dibango and Hal Singer; The Soukouss Pt1&2; Afrodeclic 8. Spanky Wilson; Sunshine Of Your Love; Ghetto Funk 9. Tribe; Baby Feet; Funk Fu - Psych Funk vs Rare Grooves 1970-1976 10. Eddie Palmieri; Chocolate Ice Cream; SuperImposition 11. George Soule; Get Involved; The Soul of the Black Panther Era Vol 1 12. Bama the Village Poet; Ghettoes of the Mind; Ghettoes of the Mind 13. Fatback; Is This the Future; New York Sound: From the East Coast to the Future 14. The Johnny Rocco Band; Rocco; Rocco 15. Sass; Do It; Funk Fu - Psych Funk vs Rare Grooves 1970-1976 16. Robert Lowe; Back to Funk; Westbound Funk 17. Black Heat, Love the Life You Live; Funk Drops - Breaks Nuggets and Rarities Another blast from the past, and lots of players I missed along the way, their messages still speak out loud and clear, so much to hope for and yet so much remains the same. How much we like to talk about evolution, and when you look at the brave new technologies that abound, you have to wonder that if the mind can create and develop such profound changes and mechanisms within society, why can't there be the same profound changes in society itself? The ghettoes of the world have expanded in the last 30+ years, the environmental carnage has taken on globally catastrophic potential, plugged in to the i-pods we remain oblivious to so much human suffering. So I ask again, how can we have such a brilliant technological revolution while elsewhere the sounds of hungry stomachs, the shivering of the shelterless and the persistent poisoning of our most valuable asset, water,(by industry and mining) is an ever-increasing thrum rising across the planet? Hope you like the mix..... Notes: 1. http://www.reneegeyer.com.au/ 3. http://www.nathanielturner.com/weldonirvine.htm 5. http://www.biography.com/articles/James-Brown-9228350 7. http://home.earthlink.net/~v1tiger/hsinger.html 8. http://www.spanky-wilson.com/ 10. http://www.eddiepalmierimusic.com/ 11. http://www.furious.com/perfect/georgesoule.html 13. http://www.fatbackband.com/ 14. http://www.sergent.com.au/music/leodecastro.html 17. http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Black_Heat
